result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND TO COVER 22GF1034 & 22CT217

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1500 CASH
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant must comply with any IID order. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): GENEVA MOTORS IN DARIEN. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 
22-4653; BJM

Defendant Benjamin D Plautz in court, in custody by video. JJ Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman appeared for bond purposes only. Total signature bond set with same prior conditions and $1500 cash component. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

*SEE UPDATED BOND FROM 10/11/2022*
DEFENDANT MUST POST $1500 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
